TopicTitle: Amazon to adapt Culture book into a Prime Video

Articles.Content:
Great! I just started re-reading the Culture series, I can't wait to see an Orbital on TV!

Even better, its on Amazon Prime, the one streaming service I have, so I can actually watch it, and not have to settle for clips and trailers like The Expanse.
That's irony if I've ever seen one. Banks would have hated Bezos, and I have a nagging suspicion this is only happening because he's not around to stop it.

1 hour ago, ModZero said:

That's irony if I've ever seen one. Banks would have hated Bezos, and I have a nagging suspicion this is only happening because he's not around to stop it.

Maybe... Honestly, however, the only way for the sort of communalism Banks proposed in the Culture books, is a true post-scarcity universe. Here on Earth, it's utterly impossible, and always will be, if for no other reason than habitable area is finite.

I suppose anyone who thinks such a utopia is possible here on Earth would like the fact that Amazon is being turned against itself (his narrative being paid for by a money-driven leviathan).

Regarding this project, if it is good, and if it makes money, the nice thing is that the books are disconnected enough from each other, and people can do things like change sex, that it makes a series easy.
